Package templeengine.src.core

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • templeengine.src.core.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackgroundThing, Bullet, DeathTrigger, EndTrigger, Enemy, Player, Player, Tile, Walls

    public abstract class GameObject
extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView
    The GameObject is a ImageView used for any game object you want to render on screen.

    This class utilizes the already powerful ImageView class and adds in extra functionality for game related functions, such as automatic updates in conjunction with the GameCanvas class, automatic collision detection and acting upon it, etc.

    You can find example codes on GameObjects in the examples folder.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected double angle
      Used for rotating the object.
      protected Animation currentAnimation
      The currently playing Animation of the object.
      protected int currentFrame
      Current frame of the current animation.
      boolean isCollidable
      Whether the object can trigger onCollision() calls or not.
      boolean isStatic
      If an object is marked static (and can collide), it won't search for objects to collide with, but can be collided with.
      boolean isTrigger
      If an object is marked as a trigger (and can collide), instead of calling onCollision(), it will call onTrigger() instead.
      protected int lastFrame
      Last frame the animation was updated on.
      protected java.lang.String name
      Name of the object.
      protected double velocityX
      VelocityX of the object.
      protected double velocityY
      VelocityY of the object.
      protected double x
      X position of the object.
      protected double y
      Y position of the object.

    • Field Detail

      • angle

        protected double angle
        Used for rotating the object.

      • currentAnimation

        protected Animation currentAnimation
        The currently playing Animation of the object.

      • currentFrame

        protected int currentFrame
        Current frame of the current animation.

      • lastFrame

        protected int lastFrame
        Last frame the animation was updated on.

      • velocityX

        protected double velocityX
        VelocityX of the object. Added to position every update.

      • velocityY

        protected double velocityY
        VelocityY of the object. Added to position every update.

      • x

        protected double x
        X position of the object.

      • y

        protected double y
        Y position of the object.

      • name

        protected java.lang.String name
        Name of the object. Can be used to differentiate between objects of the same class.

      • isCollidable

        public boolean isCollidable
        Whether the object can trigger onCollision() calls or not.

      • isStatic

        public boolean isStatic
        If an object is marked static (and can collide), it won't search for objects to collide with, but can be collided with. Marking static objects such as walls as static is a good idea.

      • isTrigger

        public boolean isTrigger
        If an object is marked as a trigger (and can collide), instead of calling onCollision(), it will call onTrigger() instead.

        public GameObject​()

    • Method Detail

      • setExistanceBounds

        public void setExistanceBounds​(javafx.geometry.Bounds bounds)
        Sets the existanceBounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - the bounds to be set.

      • alignColliders

        public void alignColliders​()
        Aligns the objects colliders to match its position and rotation.

      • changeAnimation

        public void changeAnimation​(Animation animation)
        Changes the currentAnimation of the object and sets the currentFrame to zero.
        Parameters:
        animation - animation to be set.

      • changeAnimation

        public void changeAnimation​(Animation animation,
                            int frame)
        Changes the currentAnimation of the object and sets the currentFrame to a desired value.
        Parameters:
        animation - animation to be set.
        frame - the frame to start the new animation from.

      • fixedUpdate

        public void fixedUpdate​()
        Updates the object in fixed intervals. Fixed update is called within fixed intervals, and such are good for physics checks. GameObjects update the position based on velocity, and aligns its colliders to the parent.

      • update

        public void update​()
        Updates the object whenever possible. Normal update is called every tick of the game engine, thus running at a higher rate than fixedUpdate() This makes it unsuitable for expensive calls like collision checks, but great for other stuff GameObjects update their animations here.

      • postUpdate

        public void postUpdate​()
        Called after update. Good for updating camera position on.

      • onTrigger

        public void onTrigger​(javafx.scene.shape.Shape intersection,
                      GameObject hitObject)
        Called when this object is a trigger and has intersected with another collidable object.
        Parameters:
        intersection - is the shape of the intersection happened.
        hitObject - is the object hit.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(javafx.scene.shape.Shape intersection,
                        GameObject hitObject)
        Called when this object is not a trigger and has intersected with another collidable object. GameObjects are unable to go through other collidable GameObjects and will stop on collision.
        Parameters:
        intersection - is the shape of the intersection happened.
        hitObject - is the object hit.

      • rotate

        public void rotate​(double amount)
        Rotates the object. Positive numbers for clockwise.
        Parameters:
        amount - of angles to rotate this object by.

      • setVelocityForward

        public void setVelocityForward​(double velocity)
        Sets the velocity based on the rotation of the object.
        Parameters:
        velocity - the velocity.

        Parameters:
        c - the collider to add.

        Removes a collider to the object.
        Parameters:
        c - the collider to remove.
